snippet: The first woman to command the Army’s drill sergeant training took legal action to reclaim her job, alleging she was improperly suspended last year because of sexism and racism.
abstract: Command Sgt Maj Teresa King, the first woman to command the Army’s drill sergeant training, takes legal action to reclaim her job; suit alleges that she was improperly suspended in 2011 because of sexism and racism and demands that two of her superiors be investigated for abuse of their authority.
